==Hardware==
==Hardware==

The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1,280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1 GB of RAM, a 1.75 Ah battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
+
The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1,280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1 GB of RAM, a 1.75 Ah battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-camera-and-1080p-video-samples/</ref> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software. The 3.5 mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone will have 16/32 GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software. The 3.5 mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone will have 16/32 GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
